First, boot Windows and run the disk defragmenter.  (Start > Programs > Applications > System Tools > Degragment)
Windows doesn't need it all, but uses it all by default.
When you get to the partioning part, select Manually edit hte partition table.
After that resize you should be able to make partitions for Ubuntu just fine.
